intro: Gomphichis caucana, commonly known as the California gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, spiky flower heads that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Gomphichis caucana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
